content.user_instructions:
The user provided the additional info about how they would like you to respond:
```Follow the instructions below naturally, without repeating, referencing, echoing, or mirroring any of their wording!

All the following instructions should guide your behavior silently and must never influence the wording of your message in an explicit or meta way!

don't be too verbose, be short and concise
do not glaze me, you don't have to make comments like wow you are so smart. 
just be informational and direct. 
Adopt a skeptical, questioning approach.```

user_context_message_data.about_model_message:

do not glaze me, you don't have to make comments like wow you are so smart. 
just be informational and direct. 
Adopt a skeptical, questioning approach.

entries.title: These $140 earbuds translate 50+ languages while you listen
entries.snippet: The Mymanu Orb Open-Ear AI Translation Earbuds, showcased at CES 2026, offer users a unique blend of audio entertainment, real-world awareness, and advanced language translation technology. Priced at $139.99 (down from a $179.99 MSRP), these earbuds feature an open-ear design that allows users to hear their surroundings while simultaneously listening to music, taking calls, or translating real-time conversations. The standout feature is their built-in AI, which supports translation in over 50 languages across live conversations, phone calls, and spoken audio—ideal for travel, work, or multilingual environments. Beyond translation, the earbuds function as typical audio accessories with a sleek, lightweight, and water-resistant design. With up to 35 hours of battery life using the charging case and hands-free controls, they offer a user-friendly and futuristic audio solution without added complexity.

entries.title: Meta's AI translation tool can dub your Instagram videos
entries.snippet: Meta is expanding its AI translation tool to more users on Facebook and Instagram, allowing automatic dubbing of reels between English and Spanish. The tool utilizes AI to generate voiceovers matching the user’s voice and mouth movements. To use it, creators can activate the "Translate voices with Meta AI" toggle before publishing a reel. The feature also supports optional lip-syncing and allows review before sharing. Translated reels are automatically shown to users in their preferred language and are marked with a disclosure tag indicating AI translation. The rollout is currently available to Facebook creators with at least 1,000 followers and all public Instagram accounts.

entries.title: Audible unveils plans to use AI voices to narrate audiobooks
entries.snippet:
Audible has announced plans to utilize AI-generated voices to narrate audiobooks, with AI-powered translation capabilities to be introduced later in the year. The Amazon-owned company will allow select publishers to access its AI production tools, offering either Audible-managed services or self-service production. Publishers can choose from over 100 AI voices in English, Spanish, French, and Italian. Audible CEO Bob Carrigan emphasized that the goal is to make more stories accessible globally while maintaining quality through optional human checks for translations.

However, the announcement has sparked criticism from writers, translators, and voice actors who argue that AI cannot replicate the emotional depth and artistic nuance of human narration. Critics, including veteran audiobook narrators and literary translators, warn that the widespread use of AI could marginalize diverse voices, reduce quality, and commodify creativity. Concerns were also raised about transparency and the ethical use of authors' work, with calls for clear labeling and author consent. Audible previously allowed U.S. self-published authors to use its “virtual voice” tool, resulting in over 60,000 AI-narrated audiobooks. Audible’s announcement comes amid increasing competition from platforms like Spotify in the audiobook market.

entries.title: Smartcat
Otter.ai App Adds French and Spanish Transcription: What You Need to Know
entries.snippet:
Otter.ai has expanded its capabilities by adding real-time transcription support for French and Spanish, in addition to English. The app, available on both Android and iOS, allows users to record and transcribe meetings and conversations directly from their mobile device or through a web interface that integrates with platforms like Zoom, Microsoft Teams, and Google Meet. However, it does not offer translation services, so users must be fluent in the chosen language.

The app is free with a Basic plan offering 300 transcription minutes per month (30 minutes per conversation) and limits to three imported files. The Pro plan, costing $16.99/month or $100 annually, raises these limits to 1200 minutes per month, 90 minutes per conversation, and up to 10 imported files. Business and Enterprise plans are also available for users needing more extensive features. Users can edit transcriptions to correct any errors.

entries.title: Samsung Galaxy Buds3 FE launched with real-time translation at Rs 12,999
entries.snippet: Samsung has launched the Galaxy Buds3 FE in India, adding to its audio product portfolio. Priced at ₹12,999, the new earbuds come with a Blade design and integrate Galaxy AI features. One of the standout capabilities is real-time translation, enhancing convenience for users in multilingual environments. The Buds3 FE also promise better sound quality, smarter features, and improved comfort for everyday use. This launch underscores Samsung’s continued investment in intelligent and immersive audio technology tailored for the Indian market.

v.title: MuAViC: A Multilingual Audio-Visual Corpus for Robust Speech Recognition and Robust Speech-to-Text Translation

entries.title: Brightcove Unveils New AI Features
entries.snippet:
Brightcove has announced the release of seven new AI-powered features aimed at expanding global access, increasing engagement, enhancing live-streaming quality, and optimizing video workflows. These updates are part of a larger rollout of 12 tools introduced recently, and nearly 150 customers are already testing the new capabilities. A major highlight is the upgraded AI Suite, including a Universal Translator that supports video localization in over 50 languages and offers refined dubbing options such as synthetic and speaker-modeled voices. 

The Auto-Captions feature now offers greater accuracy and customization through the addition of a brand-sensitive dictionary. Another notable tool, Metadata Optimizer, enhances searchability and SEO by analyzing text, audio, and visuals, with support for over 40 languages. 

For mobile engagement, a new Vertical Videos gallery template enables swipeable video feeds on company websites. Also, the NextGen Live upgrade brings 4K UHD streaming, low-latency (as little as 8 seconds), and a unified system for live streaming, ad insertion, and content protection—enhancing quality, security, and monetization potential.

entries.title: Save $67 on these translator earbuds that help you talk in 37 different languages
entries.snippet: The article highlights a limited-time sale on the Mymanu CLIK S translation earbuds, which are currently available for $89.97, down from their regular price of $157—a 42% discount valid through April 21. These award-winning earbuds, showcased at CES, enable real-time voice translation in 37 languages through the MyJuno app, making them ideal for travelers needing help with communication abroad. Users can either type or speak their question, and the app will translate and vocalize it for locals, while also converting responses back into English. Beyond translation, the earbuds offer up to 30 hours of combined battery life, water resistance, and can also be used for music and calls. They are compatible with voice assistants on both iPhone and Android devices.
